author: Staff Reporter
text:
An audio purportedly tapped when Tiruvannamalai taluk police inspector Palani demanded Rs. 5 lakh from an advocate to desist arresting his party accused in some criminal case, and circulated in WhatsApp landed him in trouble and he has been transferred.

In the 10-minute long audio, an advocate named Kumar asks the Inspector not to arrest one ‘Devadoss’ whose wife was in the ninth month of pregnancy.

The Inspector demands the caller come to Chennai where he was when the call was made with Rs. 5 lakh in cash the very next day.

He also promises to give Rs.1 lakh to someone called Lingesh and Rs.1 lakh to the advocate Kumar. In return, he promises not to arrest Devadoss as long as he was there (in the station).

Transferred

When asked about it, Superintendent of Police R. Ponni said, “Enquiry is going on in this matter and the inspector has been transferred to Vellore district.”
title: Audio clip shared on WhatsApp shows inspector demanding bribe
